title: Administrative/Clerical Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ferris State University
Interview Descriptions: Great interview process ran by a separate committee of the department you are applying to instead of an HR department that does not actually know about the position they are hiring for.
Interview Questions:
What is your biggest failure?
What is your greatest success?
Tell me about yourself.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Ferris State University
Interview Descriptions: First stage was simple and informal, no hard questions. Campus visit was unorganized and uneventful. Job talk was to faculty and students with no feedback or questions. People were nice but did not engage with you. Not much effort put into representing the school and place well. Worst of all, reimbursement for flight and meals took months! Avoid unless you are from the area and don't think twice.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable teaching 4 or 5 classes per semester?

title: Desk Service Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Ferris State University (Big Rapids, MI) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: Upon applying you need your resume and a complete cover letter. You will be required to have an interview with 3 hall directors and some student staff members. This is to ensure all parties view you as someone able to work with college students.
Interview Questions: How would I connect with residents/peers?

title: Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Ferris State University (Big Rapids, MI) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Sat on a board in front of the manager and coordinator. They asked questions based around your experience and situational scenarios. Its a very thought provoking interview. Just be honest. They take people of all backgrounds.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be an orientation leader?

title: Line Cook Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Ferris State University (Big Rapids, MI) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Just walk in and ask for a job. pretty straight forward and interview took 10 minutes. You pick your own schedule and it was as simple as that. they may ask some questions regarding your work ethic, but these are simple to answer.

title: Support Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Ferris State University (Big Rapids, MI) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was semi-formal and I met with several of the key players within the department. They asked down to earth questions, allowed me to ask questions, and I felt very at ease.
Interview Questions: They asked about my strengths and weaknesses.

title: Personnel Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Ferris State University (Big Rapids, MI) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: The assistant director was very nice and opens minded. She is will to go above and beyond. I love working with her. She is a culture geek like me. We always come up with fun events
Interview Questions: What does customer service mean to you?

title: Finance Department Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Ferris State University
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview initially, then an in-person interview. Each interview took at least 30 minutes and general interview questions were asked, such as strengths, weaknesses, why you want this job, etc. I was satisfied with the interview process. I wish the university was quicker in making decisions and would not make the process longer than it needed to be.
Interview Questions: Can you describe a time you worked with a difficult customer and how did you resolve the issue or complaint?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Ferris State University (Big Rapids, MI) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions:
go through papers, look data up on computer
the interview was very laid back and they just need someone to fit in for the job.
the pay was normal and they work around schooling
Interview Questions: not many, be there on time, good with talking to people

title: Adventure Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Ferris State University (Big Rapids, MI) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very uninformed hiring committee.  They had to ask me the technical names for the equipment used on the job so they could use these terms when interviewing the next candidate.  The hiring committee had no experience in this field.  The process was started with a phone interview, which was very short.  Just a couple of questions, then setting up the on=campus interview.  Interview was conducted by a 3 person committee.  Interview format was situational based.
Interview Questions: Why are you qualified for this position

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Ferris State University
Interview Descriptions: Had the phone interview. The search committee was very nice. I think I did very well. Two days later, they contacted me and officially invited me to visit their campus.
Interview Questions: What do I know about Ferri State Univversity?

title: International Student Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ferris State University
Interview Descriptions: They called me in the first round and scheduled skype interview with them for the second round. I am stil preparing for the second round, but they said they would let me know the result in a few weeks.
Interview Questions: why do you think international student would come to Ferris State University?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Ferris State University
Interview Descriptions: adjunct temporary full time contract employee

title: Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Ferris State University in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Committee interview, parading in different groups every 30 minutes with the standard battery of questions such as what are your strengths, how do you handle difficult people, yawn. The worst part is I'm a vegetarian and no one had the sensitivity to ask what I would like for lunch.  A sad tray of sandwiches was plunked down in front of me, all meat. When I said I was fine and didn't need lunch, one of the committee members put a bloody red roast beef sandwich on a plate in front of me and said "Don't be shy, you can eat!".  It took everything I had not to throw up, I picked at the bread and cheese. Horrible!
Interview Questions: Among the worst interview questions has to be "What do you know about me?" I did my research and answered the question well however the interviewer basically was seeking praise and self edification. Second worst "Why should we hire you?" Probably one of the most painful interview experiences of my life.
